fields.description: It seems that someone has been able to comment on Jira issues without having an account.   Google on "massagelondon site:logicblaze.com" to see the offending issues.
fields.summary: Filing comments w/ no Jira account

fields.description:
And sweet jesus H! The field/screen/custom field configuration needs some serious attention.
Its just way too confusing.
fields.summary: Custom Field scope : Any Issue Type doesnt seem to display the field in the screen (when using issue-type-specific screens)

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: Updating a transition (editing the name - changing case) results in an error

fields.description:
This isn't so much a bug as a query, and given that we're using an older version of Jira it may be moot.

What I'm wondering is why the mime-type for screenshots created using the Java applet is image/pjpeg?
I believe that this is an Internet Explorer-specific mime-type, but shouldn't it technically be image/jpeg or image/x-pjpeg?

It's all rather semantic really.. but just curious.
fields.summary: image/pjpeg mime type?

fields.description:
upgrade task 93 is not run on setup but upgrade task 10 is.  
10 turns the cache on.
93 turns it off.

This will only effect new instances of jira from 3.2 to 3.3.2

need new task to turn it off again and run at set-up
fields.summary: Issue cache is on by default in new installations

fields.description:
When deleting a user as Jira administrator, I should either get:
- a warning that the user has filters
- filters should be deleted for that user

This is different than issue JRA-6561 - which is the ability to allow Jira adminstrators to delete filters.

When managing the user accounts, the application should either take the steps to clean up the user fitlers or at least warn the administrator that there are filters.

To reproduce,

Create a user.  Create a filter for that user - a global one is easier to spot.
Delete the user.
Look at the home page and see that the global filter still exists.
Go to manage filters and there will be no owner for that filter.
Go to the database, and you'll see that the filter exists and that the searchrequest.authorname will have the name of the deleted user.
fields.summary: When deleting a user, the filters for that user should either be deleted or a warning issued.

fields.description:
I was hoping we could add a new filter by date function. I would love to be able to create and save a filter where it would always be able to query for all tickets "assigned to me" and "due today"


Currently in version 3.2.1 there is no way to save "due today" as a criteria, you always have to specify a date. I would love I didn't have to specify an exact date and I could use whatever the "current day" is as the criteria instead.

Thanks for considering this option.
fields.summary: JIRA filter by date criteria
Reorganize sub-task order within the parent task

fields.description: Copying and pasting into JIRA allows pasting of values below hex 32 other than the permitted values. When output in the RSS feed these are escaped with their appropriate values e.g.  but this is invalid in XML as it is not permitted as a unicode character. It makes my XML parser (MSXML 2.0) fall over with the message "Invalid UNICODE Character" when parsing the XML version of the issue in RSS.
fields.summary: JIRA allows the entry of invalid UNICODE characters in description and comment, but these create invalid XML strings in the rss feeds

fields.description:
Because JIRA creates an attachment folder with the same name as the project key, the code CON is not allowed on Windows 2003 (and other Windows installations) because CON is a reserved word.

One of my administrators created a projekt with the code CON. We found out, that is was impossible to attach documents to this project, becaus the folder couldn't be created.

After that we wanted to delete the projekt. This is not possible. See attachment.

By the way: the issue CON-1 has no attachments.

What do we do to get rid of the project?

I suggest you make a check when creating a project to make sure, the key allows the creation of a folder. If not, the key shoul be invalid.
fields.summary: Project code CON is invalid and cannot be deleted

fields.summary: Timeout generates an ugly error

fields.description:
Due to an unsynchronized method call in Ofbiz, it is possible for the JIRA issue cache to eventually become corrupt, resulting in users seeing errors like the following when viewing issues:

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.util.LinkedList.addBefore(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.LinkedList.addFirst(Unknown Source)
        at org.ofbiz.core.util.UtilCache.put(UtilCache.java:196)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.cache.IssueCache.addIssueCacheValueToCache(IssueCache.java:179)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.cache.IssueCache.getIssue(IssueCache.java:134)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.cache.IssueCache.getIssue(IssueCache.java:112)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.cache.DefaultCacheManager.getValueByAttribute(DefaultCacheManager.java:66)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.CachingIssueManager.getIssue(CachingIssueManager.java:42)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor113.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:71)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.DelegatingInvocationHandler.invoke(DelegatingInvocationHandler.java:27)
        at $Proxy2.getIssue(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.jira.servlet.QuickLinkServlet.service(QuickLinkServlet.java:46)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:252)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173)
        at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.parsePage(PageFilter.java:142)
        at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(PageFilter.java:58)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:202)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:173)
        at com.atlassian.seraph.filter.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:168)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:202)
fields.summary: Issue cache gets corrupted

fields.description:
I use Alt+S extensively instead of clicking the submit buttons in JIRA.

If you create an issue, and by incident press ALT+S multiple times the issues gets created just as many times. I just created the same issue with two different numbers because something weired happened with my fingers :-)

I guess this is only an issue if you have a pretty fast JIRA installation on a fast line. But still...
fields.summary: Itchy keyboard fingers can cause multiple creations of an issue
Bulk delete users

fields.description: On start-up retreive driver name, version on connection properties and check that they are using the right version of driver and that they have the connection properties set if they are using Oracle 9i.
fields.summary: Detect wrong Oracle driver and properties on start-up

fields.description: If you have a user that has commented on an issue there will be a link to an invalid user. This link should be removed and replaced with plain text.
fields.summary: Incorrect link in Full Content View if user no longer exists

fields.description:
Here is a problem that I don't have a satisfactory solution to at the moment. We put requirement either into the description or attach documents. In the case where we attach documents we have the ability to track changes however most requirements for Jira issues are relatively short and therefor are place in the descriptions field. 

Issue:  Requirements continue to change through and after completion of the development task.  (That is an issue in and of itself.)  I want to be able to see this variability.  For example, if every change to the requirements results in a distinct JIRA issue I could count them by component (map), compare one map to another, examine when these were created relative to the 'complete', JCT start/end, and production dates, and so on.  However, this is a big burden on the PM and developer to maintain correct jira issue states.

So...  How do we know/register/record all of this work that is occurring after the map is 'completed', without a burdensome process? Not sure if there is a work-around that you can recommend or whether this would require a change to Jira.
fields.summary: Would like to be able to control / track changes to requirements
Should be able to 'edit' Security Levels

fields.description: It would be helpful to have the Administration :: Projects list grouped by project categories in the same manner as is when Browsing Projects (via BrowseProjects.jspa).  Or more specifically, like the Projects portlet, when All Projects is selected (since the portlet allows collapsing categories).
fields.summary: Organize Admin :: Projects by cagegories

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a visual indicator on the Saved Filters porlet as to the shared status of a Filter.  Right now we have to add a prefix to the filter name to differentiate them to the user.

Would also be nice to have the portlet sort by shared status, then name...

And would be nice to be able to configure the portlet to only show filters of a certain shared state (to only show private or only show global, etc.).
fields.summary: Filter shared status icon in Saved Filters portlet

fields.description: At the end of section 4.14.3.2 (Adding Users/Groups to a Security Level) of "jira 3.3.1 manual.pdf" there's a typing mistake: "aAdd Users to Issue Security Levels"
fields.summary: Typing mistake in the manual

fields.description:
In the second paragraph of section 4.14.3 of "jira 3.3.1 manual.pdf" there's a typing mistake: "levl" instead of "level"

"Assigning a user/group to a security level will enable that user/group to view any issues that have
their security level set to that levl."
fields.summary: Typing mistake in the manual

fields.description:
Depending on a filter description, the filter name won't be displayed correctly in the shared filters portlet. This was not the case in JIRA 3.1.1.

This happens if you create a filter ( || is just to delimiter the values!): 
- name : |My filter|
- description : |Liste l'ensemble des fiches dont le status est "open" ou "ready for change", qui sont assignées à l'utilisateur courant |
The leading white space in the description is important!

The problem appears also with |" '|.
fields.summary: Filter names not displayed properly in shared Filter portlet, depending on their description

fields.description:
Hi, 

Currently i can not setup an user, which is allow only to create issues, and folow up the issues he/she created before.

I alwas have to give the "Browse project" permission to make it work at all.

Having a user with only "Create" & "Comment" permission who is able to see its own issues anyway would be reaaly great...

Regards
Michael
fields.summary: Permission to allow only "own" issues

fields.description:
Context :
I copied an existing, active workflow to add a 6th step. I added the new status, etc.
I created a new workflow scheme and a new project so as to test the new workflow. I was not satisfied with the screens on the introduced transitions between steps.

Action:
As I was unable to edit the workflow because it was active, I deleted my test project.

Result:
Unfortunately, the workflow is still reported as active, and therefore I still cannot edit it.

Comment:
I also deleted the test workflow scheme I created, but the workflow remains active.
I guess the workaround is to copy this workflow and work on the copy, but I fear I will have to keep this "ghost workflow".
fields.summary: A workflow remains activated when the only project using it is deleted

fields.description:
if a service has a Date property, the Edit Service renders a date picker field, but the date picker javascript isn't included in the page, so clicking on the date picker doesn't work.

I fixed it locally by adding the date picker javascript to secure/admin/views/services/editservice.jsp:

@@ -9,6 +9,7 @@
 </head>
 
 <body>
+    <jsp:include page="/includes/js/date_picker.jsp" flush="true" />
 
 <page:applyDecorator name="jiraform">
        <page:param name="action">EditService.jspa</page:param>
fields.summary: Date picker javascript missing from Admin/EditService
Ability to trigger the service to run now in the UI

fields.description:
I rebooted our JIRA server yesterday. Today, after 24 hours of use, the cache looks like this:

Current Cache Size  	0
Cache Capacity 	5000
Hits Count 	0
Miss Count 	719 	 

What causes the cache to be empty? Shouldn't JIRA cache every issue that has been created or edited since the last reboot?
fields.summary: Empty cache

fields.description:
It would be really handy to be able to clone an existing portlet when configuring a user's dashboard.

This feature would make it a little bit easier to add new portlets of the same flavor.
fields.summary: Add the ablity to clone a portlet

fields.description: Get a list of Jira issues via search, click on "Printable" view, resort the list by say Asignee, then the view jumps back to the normal view.
fields.summary: Resorting a list of issues on print review jumps back to non-print view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8023].
  {panel}

Basically, we want to be able to filter on issues on the basis of their SCM information
a) Have some checkins against them (on given branch(es) and commit date constraints)
b) have no checkins against them

We need to do this to find 
a) issue fixes that were not checked into the required branches
b) issues that were checked into the right branches - but the fix version in jira is incorrect or missing
fields.summary: Add Filter  criteria for version control entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8022].
  {panel}

In Confluence it is possible to edit a text and check "minor change, no notifications will be sent" to diable e-mail notifications about the change.

This feature would be really helpful in JIRA, to avoid the e-mail "spamming" that exists today, because JIRA cant be configured to e.g. only send mail once a day including all relevant changes.

If one of my customers reports an issue, and i add 10 attachments to the issue. The customer receives 10 e-mails. This is annoying.

If i could check a "minor change, no notifications will be sent" field when

- executing a workflow action
- edition an issue
- creating an attachment
- adding a comment

that would be a great feature.

Of course, there should be a permission allowing this fuctionality. I don't want my customers to be able to edit issues without notifying me.
fields.summary: Minor change, no notifications will be sent

fields.description:
Hello,
Following Problem:
We have createted a custom version picker field:  "due release",
I can edit this field via "edit issue" and can see all versions of our project.
But when i try to search for  issues with special "due release" -entries,
the drop-down-list-field in "find issue" "edit" is empty and i can not choose
any version.
Greetings,
Holger
fields.summary: Searching Custom Version Picker Fields

fields.description: It would be useful to show whether parsing the CVS logs was successful the last time it occurred. This can be shown as a 'status' for each confgured CVS module in JIRA. If an error occurred it could be captured and shown for each repository as well.
fields.summary: Report whether the last parse of the CVS log was successful or not. If not show the error.

fields.description: If you are logged out of jira, the votes and watches portlets are still available from the default dashboard.
fields.summary: User Portlets still shown on dashboard on logout
Clone subtask to another parent issue

fields.description: Jira admins who are only assigned to the groups "jira-users" and "jira-administrators" have no access to information in any other projects. So they always get an empty list of assignements for users in other projects and can delete them without warnings.
fields.summary: Jira admins can delete users who have assigned issues

fields.description:
Was creating a new issue: filled some fields and working in a different application while the issue creation form open in the browser (IE).
Suddenly (seems, without any interaction) the page reloaded with the message:
Error instantiating webwork.multipart.parser.class: com.atlassian.jira.web.JiraMultipartRequestWrapper(original message: null) 
See also a screenshot attached.
fields.summary: "Error instantiating webwork.multipart.parser.class" during issue creation

fields.description:
I have an issue with the status set to "Open". I also have 1 linked issue with the status set to "Closed". When I am in the Issue Navigator and when I click on "Full content" the status of the linked issue is no longer set to "Closed" but "Open" (status of the issue).

The problem occurs in Jira 3.3.1 & 3.3 but not in 3.2.3.
fields.summary: Full Content - Status & Priority of Linked Issues wrong

fields.description:
When Time Tracking is set to:
  Time Tracking is currently ON.
  The number of working hours per day is 8.
  The number of working days per week is 5.

There is bad calculated Time in preview. In detail it is calculated ok.
fields.summary: Different values displayed in different views of same field - TimeSpent

fields.summary: When clicking one of the statistics in a portlet that uses a select list custom field with a non-global context a null pointer exception occurs

fields.description: I wrote a very simple SOAP client to test the available workflow actions on our system (attached). Unfortunately it sporadically crashes when calling getAvailableActions() or getFieldsForAction(), with the attached exceptions.  Note that the getIssue call always seems to succeed (both before and after the crash) and I am also able to successfully add comments to actions.  I have set up all the SOAP bindings to be in the package com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soapclient.
fields.summary: java.lang.IllegalStateException: getAttribute: Session already invalidated when trying to call getAvailableActions or getFieldsForAction

fields.description: This has the effect of some issues being created in the database but not in the index. If the user then tries to bulk delete the issues, they are only presented with indexed issues, and hence cannot bulk deletete all created issues. The shadow issues are not discovered until one triggers a full reindex.
fields.summary: If there is an exception thrown when setting the issue status during CSV import the issue is not indexed

fields.description: The version distributed with JIRA is patched to increase the size of the buffer. I beleive the pathc has been merged into the 0.1.21 release of jsch. Need to check this and if the patch is there, distribute 0.1.21 with JIRa and remove it from the subversion plugin.
fields.summary: Ensure that the jsch version between the subverison plugin and JIRA are synchronised

fields.description: JIRA 3.2 JIRA's log4j configuration is set to log to a 'atlassian-jira.log' file in the directory JIRA is started up from (this is to get some logs from Windows console users, who otherwise have to cut & paste). However due to an oversight, only logs from 'log4j.rootLogger' get sent here, not logs from categories overridden further in the file.
fields.summary: Some logs don't go to atlassian-jira.log log file

fields.description:
The Jira admin can delete a user who has shared filters.  After a while this then causes an exception on the Dashboard page. 


(It would be nice if the admin also had the ability to edit all filters, and delete/modify them if required, e.g. when a user needs to be deleted).
fields.summary: Jira admin can delete a user who has 'shared filters' which then causes an exception on Dashboard

fields.description:
In case you use a custom list box it would be a nice feature
if it would be possible to search for multiple entries.

For example: 
A listbox has four entries "A", "B","C","D",
I would like to search for issues with entry "A or B"
fields.summary: Searching for multiple entries in list-boxes

fields.description:
Dear JIRA support,

actually we would like to add a log file rotation for all the output, what is normally print our in the console.
For this, we added at the moment in the "catalina.sh" the following line:

  touch "$CATALINA_BASE"/logs/catalina.out
  if [ "$1" = "-security" ] ; then
    echo "Using Security Manager"
    shift
    "$_RUNJAVA" -Xms256m  -Xmx512m $JAVA_OPTS -Djava.awt.headless=true -Dorg.apache.commons.logging.Log=org.apache.commons.logging.impl.SimpleLog -Dorg.apache.commons.logging.sim
plelog.log.org.enhydra.jdbc.xapool=warn $CATALINA_OPTS \
      -Djava.endorsed.dirs="$JAVA_ENDORSED_DIRS" -classpath "$CLASSPATH" \
      -Djava.security.manager \
      -Djava.security.policy=="$CATALINA_BASE"/conf/catalina.policy \
      -Dcatalina.base="$CATALINA_BASE" \
      -Dcatalina.home="$CATALINA_HOME" \
      -Djava.io.tmpdir="$CATALINA_TMPDIR" \
      org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap "$@" start \
      >> "$CATALINA_BASE"/logs/catalina.out 2>&1 &

      if [ ! -z "$CATALINA_PID" ]; then
        echo $! > $CATALINA_PID
      fi      
  else

Do you have a better solution?

Kind regards,
Thomas Lingenfelder

IT Entwicklung & Systemintegration
ING-DiBa AG
Theodor-Heuss-Allee 106
60486 Frankfurt am Main

Telefon	069 / 27 222 6869
Telefax  069 / 27 222 6910
T.Lingenfelder@ing-diba.de
www.ing-diba.de
fields.summary: Create logfile with console information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8000].
  {panel}

we've been hit by spam recently; someone registers and then posts spam to our JIRA. We'd like an easy way to 

(i) find the spammer based on a user name (rather than email) as we've zillions of users and can't find their user account to delete it.

(ii) a way to delete all comments from that user with one click.

To see the spam, click here...

http://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en-gb&q=massagelondon+site:logicblaze.com&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8

e.g. http://jira.logicblaze.com/jira/browse/AMQ-169?page=all&decorator=printable

The user appears as 'massagelondon' but the user name is not clickable for some reason (whereas all others is)
fields.summary: better spam features to zap an offending user along with all their comments
UpdateIssueFieldFunction uses current users permission for validation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7998].
  {panel}

ProjectDelete calls removeProjectPortlets once for each search request in a project.

removeProjectPortlets then inefficiently makes database calls to get propertyStrings.
For the Jira project (if we wanted to delete it) there would be roughly 40 000 calls to delegator.findByPrimaryKey().

Takes up roughly 50% of time for Project Deletion.
fields.summary: Make project deletion more efficient - reduce database calls
Support for specifying location for storing attachments on a per-category/project basis

fields.description: When deleting a specific issue I received an exception (see attachment)
fields.summary: Exception when deleting an issue
getSubTaskIssueTypes() missing from XML-RPC interface

fields.description:
irb(main):013:0> jira.getIssue("CONF-3459")
RuntimeError: org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException: Invalid character data corresponding to XML entity ř
        from ./jira4r.rb:39:in `method_missing'
        from (irb):13

This is the same error as CONF-1188 -- you can fix it by upgrading your XML-RPC dependency to 1.2-b2-conf1188 (in the Atlassian repository), or if you're feeling brave, to 2.0.

Setting as critical because it makes most of the XML-RPC API useless as soon as one of your issues contains a high-bit char.
fields.summary: XML-RPC barfs on high-bit characters

fields.description:
We need report that displays time spent on project level (or optionally lower lever - component, issue,etc...) within given time period (mostly time period is month).

f.e.
Report for September 2005 (from 20050901 to 20050930):
Project1      3days 2hours
Project2      5days 1hour 

Is it possible create such report in current version of JIRA.
fields.summary: WorkLog report on Project basis within given timeperiod.
Have getServerInfo() remote method return the RPC plugin version number

fields.description: Just noticed, on http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/RQMC that the issue list for version 3.3.1 varies from how it is displayed for prior versions; i.e. it only shows columns  T   Key   Summary   Pr   Status   Res from 3.0.2 to 3.3. Just wondering if that was intentional.

fields.description: My organization would like to be able to limit the visibility of certain users/groups to only issues of certain types.  We could accomplish this with the issue level security, but that becomes a bit of an administration chore and training issue.  It would be nice to be able to specify a group/groups or user who should be able to see issues of a given type (unless overriden by issue level security) when the issue type is created/modified.

I dont want to be missing out on some of JIRA's great functionality.

The Python call to this SOAP method:

self.soap.addUserToGroup(self.auth, remoteGroup, remoteUser)

results in:

at 29991680>: {'exception': None, 'message': 'Invalid element in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteGroup - email'}}>

fields.description:
In Outlook-formatted emails, the current mail is separated from quoted mails by:

----Ursprüngliche Nachricht----

(or some variant), and the user can choose to strip all content below this line. In JIRA <= 3.3.1 this isn't working for the German (and other non-English) separators. The whole mail gets appended as a comment.
fields.summary: Quoted email not stripped when adding comments in German Outlook format

fields.description:
Resolution System Field has been changed so that it can never be made requried, see if we need an upgrade task that will fix up an fieldLayoutItems that make it requried. 
 The change has been made to make it a non-requirable field. There may be a situation where a user, in a previous version of Jira, has set the field as required which will set the FieldLayoutItem in the db to have required=true. We need to check if this will mess things up (I think it will) and if so then create an upgrade task that will set that value to false.
fields.summary: Resolution System Field has been changed so that it can never be made requried, see if we need an upgrade task that will fix up an fieldLayoutItems that make it requried
Road Map - allow configuration of number of versions to be displayed

fields.description:
JIRA defines *Open* as a Status of *UNRESOLVED*. This is a system status that we cannot change.
The confusion comes when the Issue moves through the workflow.

For example:
 
An issue is assigned to a developer.
 
> Developer decides that he cannot fix it because he cannot reproduce it 
> so he Clicks on Not Fixed and sets the Resolution to Cannot Reproduce.
>  
> This sends the bug back to In Review.
>  
> When we send it back from In Review to the developer we current cannot 
> reset the resolution.
>  
> So we end up with a bug In Development with a status of Cannot Reproduce.
>  
> *Question 1: Is there a way to reset the resolution to UNRESOLVED so 
> that it shows up as an Open issue?*


> *Question 2: If we cannot do this, then can we add a resolution to 
> handle these cases but more precisely can we control the Resolutions to 
> be smart as to where they appear. In other words tie resolutions to the 
> Workflow functions?*
fields.summary: Can't reset the resolution to UNRESOLVED after setting the resolution to "Cannot Reproduce"

fields.description: when configuring the installation i get the error "Could not activate indexing: Error: java.lang.NullPointerException" even when i enter an absolute classpath.
fields.summary: cannot install

fields.description: The Summary' and "Operations' headers in the 'View' left-hand pane extend too far into the righthand pane. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Layout problem (css?) in Issue Navigator on Safari

fields.description:
I had entered an issue JSP-2530, now it is OK. 

But one more question about post functions - just oposite: 
I have created a workflow for Change Request issues it consist of statuses: Open, In progress, Accepted or Rejected. 
Open status has resolution - UNRESOLVED and it is OK, but I want to make that changing status from Open to Accepted or Rejected Resolution become RESOLVED. How to make it with Post funcions? 

What I did - I added a post funcion for transition - Open ->Accepted/Rejected. I selected Update issue field -> Issue field 'Resolution' ->Field value entered Resolved. But still get issue UNRESOLVED on transition from Open to Accepted or Rejected.
fields.summary: How to Change Resolution changing only status

fields.description: If a file that needs to be imported does not have all the fields within JIRA such as issue type, status, priority, component, etc.  Then there should be the ability to default the missing fields during the import process/wizard.

fields.description:
Bulk Migrate Issue Type

Whereas normal bulk move will move issues from multiple projects and issue types to a single project / issue type. Bulk migrate will allow you to migrate issues of different issue types to different  issue types
fields.summary: Bulk Migrate Issue Type

fields.description:
Bulk Move in Professional silently sets all issue types to the first issue's issue type

To work around this, make sure you only move one issue type at a time
fields.summary: Bulk Move in Professional silently sets all issue types to the first issue's issue type

I changed this to 5. Shutdown the server and restarted, and now it only allows a maximum of two. (See screenshot attached).
fields.summary: Adding multiple attachments does not work

There is no progress in the current maven plugin and there are major required enhancements pending. http://jira.werken.com/browse/MPJIRA

fields.description: Investigating RSS feeds from JIRA to Confluence. The last paragraph on the following documentation page: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.2/navigatorviews.html points the user to "the see the HTML Issue Navigator Edit Filters form". Is this referencing somewhere in the documentation or in the application? I've not been able to locate such a reference in the documentation to provide more information.

fields.description:
Select the JIRA 3.2.2 documentation link results in the 3.2.3 documentation displaying.  Bug or was there not documentation for 3.2.2?

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/
fields.summary: Documentation link for "JIRA 3.2.2" wrong

fields.description:
The fields 'Created' and 'Updated' and 'Due' are displayed in different date/time formats in 
(a) the View Issue Screen (sometimes '05.09.2005 16:45', sometimes 'Monday 16:45') 
(b) a list of issues in the Issue Navigator (always '05.09.2005') 

Can the date/time format in the View Issue Screen be changed e.g., via property file?
fields.summary: Change Date/Time Format in View Issue Screen

fields.description: The file that I need to import does not have all the fields within JIRA such as status, priority, component, etc.  Does the import process allow for defaults to be set for fields that are not present in the file?  If not, it should.
fields.summary: Importing Default Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7948].
  {panel}

This is somewhat related to JRA-2581. This is our most pressing problem regarding JIRA right now.  We have a number of projects which depend on a rather large set of common libraries.  When issues are reported they are reported against a given product even though the bug may be down in the common libraries affecting a number of products.  Many times it is not obvious if the issue is at the application level or down in the common library when it is first reported, but the issues are always reported against the product, not the libaries.  What we need is a way to easily report the same issue against multiple projects and to track them separate if need be, but also to apply changes to this issue across all the projects it is reported against.  

Basically, I'd like to see a feature that allows me to clone an issue to multiple projects and versions in one step.  This would be available at the Create, Edit , or Resolve issue stage.  Once an issue was cloned then anytime a change was made, other than to the Version or Component, it  could be applied to zero or more of the linked (of type clone) issues.   This would give us the ability track issues separately if need be or to report them against multiple products and resolve them in multiple projects (for tracking purposes) easily without having to clone/move-clone/move-clone/move for each project.

Perhaps a UI where I could check a box saying to 'Apply to multiple projects' and then Add Project/Versions to a list.  If it was a new issue it would automatically create the clones and move them to the specified projects and if it was an existing issue you could select which project to apply changes to and/or add/delete projects from the list.

We've tried to use the Cloning feature currently available to address this issue, but we're finding it is just to cumbersome to create, clone/move, clone/move, clone/move, etc to be practical.  Also, if you apply a change to one issue such as a comment, this is not propogated to the other cloned issues.  You can still get to it via the links, but it is easy for people to miss relevant information if they don't review the linked issues.
fields.summary: Ability to Create issues and automatically Clone/Move to multiple projects and maintain changes across Cloned issues
Allow user picker custom fields to have a default setting of 'Reporter'

fields.description:
Entering a URL for a logo on the Look and Feel admin page) causes an IllegalPropertyException (see attachment)

The URL that caused this exception was

http://images.google.co.uk/imgres?imgurl=http://www.cybertester.com/images/bug-ass.jpg&imgrefurl=http://www.cybertester.com/index.php&h=328&w=425&sz=19&tbnid=-it0P4gP5oUJ:&tbnh=94&tbnw=122&hl=en&start=1&prev=/images%3Fq%3Dbug%26svnum%3D10%26hl%3Den%26lr%3D%26sa%3DG
fields.summary: Logo URL > 255 characters causes IllegalPropertyException

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7945].
  {panel}

It took me almost two months to discover the tab "Change history" on the issue details page.

I thought that changes like a change of priority etc. simply aren't logged. 
In fact they are but the log is buried behind the "Change history" link.

I think that it would be better to combine comments and some of the most important "Change history" elements on the default tab.
I would suggest displaying a long, chronological list of comments, changes (readable format) etc by default with a kind of filter section on top of it, like:
[ v ] show comments    [ v ] show changes   etc.

Table like "original value | new value" isn't readable enough.
fields.summary: Change history - discovering this feature is very difficult

fields.description:
All projects have tasks that are repeating once per mounth or week... Thet are tasks for creating reports, checking systems,.. now we solve that with tasks that are never closed. 

It would be grate to have some kind of scheduler that would create new task on specified period. In that case user would be informd about task and manager would know if tasks were finished.
fields.summary: Scheduled creation of tasks

fields.description:
The behaviour of hiding a field in the project panels once the field was hidden in ONE field configuration associated with the project was recently modified to only hide the field if it was hidden in ALL field configurations. 

However, this change in behaviour was not added to the JSP that displays the 'Open Issues' panel - openissues.jsp
fields.summary: The change in "hidden" field behaviour needs to be added to the "Open Issues" panel.

fields.description:
Post 3.2.2 upgrade it appears that the emails are coming from Project Lead's email whenever someone creates a bug or assigns a bug and comments it.

What am I missing to that is causing this issue. Should I modify the workflow to perform this task ?
fields.summary: Outgoing Emails from person putting comments, assignee

fields.description: Selecting 'none' always creates an issue with the default security level.
fields.summary: A user cannot set the security level to none if the default security level is set
